questions.question_text: Which three public cloud providers are supported for VM image scanning? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ADE
ADE

Prisma Cloud supports scanning VM images on AWS, Azure, and GCP.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin-compute/vulnerability_management/vm_image_scanning

questions.question_text: Where can Defender debug logs be viewed? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B --> To view Defenderâ€™s debug logs, go to Manage > Defenders > Manage > Defenders. Select the Defender from the table and then click Actions > Logs.
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma/prisma-cloud/prisma-cloud-admin-compute/howto/review_debug_logs

D --> Defender Logs Path : /var/lib/twistlock/log/defender.log.

choices.C: From the Console, Manage > Defenders > Deploy > Defenders. Select the Defender from the deployed Defenders list, then click Actions > Logs
choices.B: From the Console, Manage > Defenders > Manage > Defenders. Select the Defender from the deployed Defenders list, then click Actions > Logs

questions.question_text: How many CLI remediation commands can be added in a custom policy sequence?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D

You can define up to 5 CLI commands in a sequence for a multi-step automatic remediation workflow. Add the commands in the sequence you want them to execute and separate the commands with a semi colon. If any CLI command included in the sequence fails, the execution stops at that point.

Selected Answer: C
The following curl command creates a single rule compliance policy for container images scanned in the CI pipeline: curl 'https://<CONSOLE>/api/v<VERSION>/policies/compliance/ci/images' \

questions.question_text:
An administrator wants to retrieve the compliance policies for images scanned in a continuous integration (CI) pipeline.

Which endpoint will successfully execute to enable access to the images via API?

choices.C: traffic that is either denied by the firewall rules or traffic that was reset by a host or virtual machine that received the packet and responded with a RST packet.
choices.D: traffic denied by the security group or traffic that was reset by a host or virtual machine that received the packet and responded with a RST packet.
choices.B: traffic that is either denied by the security group or firewall rules.
choices.A: traffic that is either denied by the security group or firewall rules or traffic that was reset by a host or virtual machine that received the packet and responded with a RST packet.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
For exclusion A.
